document_data.name: The Old Dragon Down
document_data.services: Pawnshop, [[relic]]s of [[Myth Drannor]], minor magical items, art
document_data.mainbody: The '''Old Dragon Down''' was a small pawnshop located in the city of [[Archenbridge]] during the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Location: The shop was located on the intersection between Urserpent Street and the road coming from the Arkhen Bridge, across the street from the [[Old Stonebows]] inn.

Interior.Atmosphere: The shop was frequented by [[adventurers]] looking to sell their spoils, and by shady [[mercenary|sellswords]] sharing stories while waiting for work.

document_data.Services:
The Old Dragon Down bought and sold [[relic]]s of [[Myth Drannor]], as well as small magical baublesâ€”for example, lamps that glowed without fuel and cloaks that could float in the air to provide a cover against rain.

It also served as a pawnshop, mostly frequented by unlucky adventurers. Finally it was known as the place to go for anyone looking to hire rough folk for a few coins, who weren't adverse to illegal activities such as bullying opponents or small-time thievery.
document_data.History: The name and signboard of the shop were inspired by the defeat of [[Arkhenthus]], the Mage Devourer, a ancient [[white dragon]] slain in [[Arkhen Vale]] by [[Elminster]] and his companions.
